verses.verse: Even <WH1571> today<WH3117> is my complaint<WH7879> bitter:<WH4805> my stroke<WH3027> is heavier<WH3513> than<WH5921> my groaning.<WH585>
Oh that<WH4310> <WH5414> I knew<WH3045> where I might find<WH4672> him! that I might come<WH935> even to<WH5704> his seat!<WH8499>
I would order<WH6186> my cause<WH4941> before<WH6440> him, and fill<WH4390> my mouth<WH6310> with arguments.<WH8433>
I would know<WH3045> the words<WH4405> which he would answer<WH6030> me, and understand<WH995> what<WH4100> he would say<WH559> unto me.
Will he plead<WH7378> against<WH5978> me with his great<WH7230> power?<WH3581> No;<WH3808> but<WH389> he<WH1931> would put<WH7760> strength in me.
There <WH8033> the righteous<WH3477> might dispute<WH3198> with<WH5973> him; so should I be delivered<WH6403> forever<WH5331> from my judge.<WH4480> <WH8199>
Behold, <WH2005> I go<WH1980> forward,<WH6924> but he is not<WH369> there; and backward,<WH268> but I cannot<WH3808> perceive<WH995> him:
On the left hand,<WH8040> where he doth work,<WH6213> but I cannot<WH3808> behold<WH2372> him: he hideth<WH5848> himself on the right hand,<WH3225> that I cannot<WH3808> see<WH7200> him:
But <WH3588> he knoweth<WH3045> the way<WH1870> that I take:<WH5978> when he hath tried<WH974> me, I shall come forth<WH3318> as gold.<WH2091>
My foot<WH7272> hath held<WH270> his steps,<WH838> his way<WH1870> have I kept,<WH8104> and not<WH3808> declined.<WH5186>
Neither <WH3808> have I gone back<WH4185> from the commandment<WH4687> of his lips;<WH8193> I have esteemed<WH6845> the words<WH561> of his mouth<WH6310> more than my necessary<WH4480> <WH2706> food.
But he<WH1931> is in one<WH259> mind, and who<WH4310> can turn<WH7725> him? and what his soul<WH5315> desireth,<WH183> even that he doeth.<WH6213>
For <WH3588> he performeth<WH7999> the thing that is appointed<WH2706> for me: and many<WH7227> such<WH2007> things are with<WH5973> him.
Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> am I troubled<WH926> at his presence:<WH4480> <WH6440> when I consider,<WH995> I am afraid<WH6342> of<WH4480> him.
For God<WH410> maketh my heart soft<WH7401> <WH3820> and the Almighty<WH7706> troubleth<WH926> me:
Because <WH3588> I was not<WH3808> cut off<WH6789> before<WH4480> <WH6440> the darkness,<WH2822> neither hath he covered<WH3680> the darkness<WH652> from my face.<WH4480> <WH6440>
